website_summaries.verdict: Does a good job of cleaning all the metal items in your home, including silver and gold.
pros: This product can polish and smooth raw metal
Can help bring back badly tarnished jewelry to like-new condition
Works well with a polishing wheel
Can brighten up aluminum and faucets
cons: Using this product can get a little messy

customer_reviews.title: Works great on fine jewelry!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product ! I used to spend $15 per ring at my local jewelers to get fine scratches of my ring bands. That was $75 a trip! I decided to try this product and it is amazing!!! My rings look like they did when I first purchased them! A little goes a long way. Rolite’s Midus Touch is worth EVERY CENT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cleans, removes scratches, leaves SHINE !!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try out as other methods like the polishing cloth worked to bring shine and clean but not remove light scratches or imperfections. Applied this cream to the jewelry and buffed out and wow, cleaned it beyond anything I could imagine and removed all signs of scratches. Cream turns black as your buffing out the jewelry. Well worth every penny for your fine Gold pieces.
customer_reviews.author: David Shim

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It took me less than an hour in all to polish both of my brass lamps, plus some sterling and silver plate.
customer_reviews.author: alsoanonyma

customer_reviews.title: Works on old stuff even if metal is unknown
customer_reviews.text: I have an astrolabe that is at least 50 years old and it was heavily tarnished. I got it from my father-in-law who used to sell them in his antique oriental rug store. I never knew what it was until recently and intrigued I decided to polish it up and remove the tarnish. I had used bronze/brass cleaner but it was still heavily tarnished. When I used this stuff it was like a miracle. The thing is quite shiny and looks brand new. However, because astrolabes are essentially computers from the Middle Ages I will now allow it tarnish again to get back that "old" look.
customer_reviews.author: Secret

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clean my jewelry collection. and it worked amazingly on all my silver jewelry - ones that were blackened, this stuff made it shine bright again. And it even removed the scuff marks on some of my rings! You don't have to use much of it, but have lots of rags handy because it will clean. On my 22k-24k jewelry, it cleaned it well enough but if my piece didn't have a sheen to start, it didn't make it shine. It just cleaned and restored a "brand" new look to it. Didn't leave any residue nor damage my gems. Pretty much odorless, and I used bare fingers working it; didn't irritate my skin. Great product. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: This Stuff Worked Great...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked great, very easy to use and no harsh smell. I bought to clean up my 8 tall metal vases used for our wedding that are going to be sold (not sure of metal, just said handmade in India on bottom of vase) so after reading other reviews thought I would try! Used a couple of microfiber clothes to clean with & clean ones to buff out with, each vase took about 10 minutes total to clean, they look like new again; also wore latex gloves! We also have a bunch of silver holiday decorations that need to be polished every year so will be using for those as well! Would highly recommend & will purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gives good results.
customer_reviews.text: Picture compares one polished bookend and one not polished. Difference is greater to the naked eye. Product is far superior to store brands I had tried. Learned of product from from commercial company cleaning the condo’s elevators (brass surfaces). Patience is still required for application and polishing with a soft cloth, but the finished product is worth the effort. Wish there was a spray form rather than cream (c’est la vie)!
customer_reviews.author: Myself

customer_reviews.title: it looks like I brought it in to have professionally done
customer_reviews.text: My gold wedding band had a chemical reaction with pool chlorine, turning it a rose/brass color. After using this product, it looks like I brought it in to have professionally done! Impressed and saved me $$!
customer_reviews.author: GranD

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I bought it because my husband put it in our cart (for his car) but never made the purchase. I'd never heard of it and thought, what the heck, why not. I have a chrome cat that came to mind after the tube arrived, I have tried many times over the years to polish it with pitiful results. The attached photos say it all. I also used it on an item made out of an unidentifiable metal and it is now lovely too. I just can't praise this product enough!! We have a copper range hood...that's next. I did a small test spot, again, amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Celia

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for a high shine!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a finishing shine! I even prefer this to my stick of red rouge. I don’t write a lot of reviews but felt compelled to for this product. Polished all my rings to a super high shine and only used a tiny amount of product. Should last pretty much a lifetime. If your items have a heavy, hard tarnish, you may need something with coarser grit as a first step. This stuff is excellent for that last step finish or to take out small swirls and scratches.
customer_reviews.author: KrakMonkE9

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS NOW
customer_reviews.text: I almost never write reviews but this definelty deserves 5 stars. I have a sword collection that I’ve just kept in storage for a few years. I took them out and most of them were stained. I don’t know with what, but it didn’t look right. So I tried many of the “home remedies” to get rid of stains, non of them worked until I found this product. It was almost instant. I applied this unto one of the swords and it was shining within minutes. As if it was brand new. I recommend this 100%. Can’t wait until I try this on other metals.
customer_reviews.author: omar rouzyi

customer_reviews.title: Cleans quickly  and efficiently ....
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cleaner to clean the metal and silver pieces on my saddles. The tarnish on the silver came off easy enough. (4 years worth) I used a soft dry wash cloth but I found using my finger tip to swirl the product on the silver first I was able to control it better then using a cloth. I used a cloth to wipe and buff. The silver came out looking brand new without having to work really hard at it. The product was not gritty so I was not afraid to use it on my silver .
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Okay, I am one tough customer and I love this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I was totally prepared to be disappointed in yet another polishing product but wow, did this stuff prove me wrong. I have an Alexis Bittar $200.00 gold plated necklace that had some scratches from one piece rubbing against another. Was about to trash it but thought I would give this a try. $10.00, how can you lose? It actually rubbed away the black tarnish that made it look so bad and almost totally buffed out the finer scratches. Looks brand new. I dunno what's in this but it is all that!
customer_reviews.author: gardensla

customer_reviews.title: Good Polisher and Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on my stainless steel wristwatches. It does the job on what it can handle but not on the deep scratches. Is it a good product? I think its okay. Its not the magic polisher I was hoping for. At least I don't have to pay some guy at the mall a lotta money for the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Fresh Water Fan

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been restoring an old tuba. I removed the lacquer and started with a variety of polishes. None produced a satisfactory finish. I read the reviews of this product and decided to try it. With no more effort than any other product, Midas took of the tarnish, stains, water marks etc., and left the brass looking like it was a new horn. Shiny, mirror like finish. If you’re working on brass, this is the product. When I’m finished with the polishing I’ll relaquer the horn.
customer_reviews.author: Janet W. Bajan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t clean copper very well!
customer_reviews.text: Had large copper table topper that was very tarnished. This product did take a lot of tarnish off, but it looked worse after I finished trying to polish it. It was a very uneven tarnish removal despite using tons of cleaning cloths, including microfiber per instructions. Total waste of money and it wasn’t cheap! Sorry I tried it. Non of the shiny copper came thru like with other brands I’ve used in past. I should have ordered cleaner/polish specific to copper.
customer_reviews.author: Dody

customer_reviews.title: Wow - you need this!
customer_reviews.text: I had micro scratches and scuffs on my Apple Watch stainless steel link band. It’s a $350 band so I didn’t want to replace it but it wasn’t looking so great. I bought this cream hoping it would make a little impact on the look of the band. Wow! This had the band looking almost as good as new. So much black grime came off the band and it shines like new. I would say 85% of the scratches are no longer noticeable. I will use this product forever.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyintheD

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works!
customer_reviews.text: I had a bathtub brass drain and cap that had turned black. I tried cleaning it with everything under the sun and nothing would get the tarnish off. This stuff did it! You put some of the polishing cream on a soft cloth and rub onto the metal you are cleaning and then rub off the black tarnish with a dry microfiber cloth. I did it about 3 times and it was shiny like new! I highly recommend this product. A little goes a LONG way.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Payne

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works! A little goes a long way when you use some good old fashioned elbow grease and an old soft cloth/rag. I had several cherished silver pieces that became tarnished during this Covid lockdown and within a few min they are looking shiny as new!! Note: it does take a couple of rounds washing with a grease cutting soap to fully get off your hands. But I do Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: k simmons

customer_reviews.title: Works ok.
customer_reviews.text: Decent silver polish but it leaves a very metallicy smell afterwards. I use(d) this polsih to clean up watches I buy. It seems to brighten things up a bit, but it's not by any means a miracle cute for removing scratches (so don't buy this expecting that). The biggest downfall for me is that it leaves a really strong abrasive meatalic smell to the silver you're polishing.
customer_reviews.author: Bigred25929

customer_reviews.title: Tarnish be gone!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a sterling silver ring which had been left in a box out in the garage, in the hot/cold of desert weather, for over 15 yrs. The ring was so tarnished, one would not suspect it was sterling silver. Wish I had taken pics of before/after but I was so excited to receive this product - and wear the ring - that I immediately got to work. After a few minutes of polishing, the ring was brand new! Have since used on other sterling silver jewelry and am quite pleased with Midas Touch!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: The best metal polish ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it promised to do. I had a big metal centerpiece bowl that had a water mark (a streak actually) and lots of surface scratches. After some elbow grease and a couple of repeated applications, 90% of them came out. Now the bowl really does look like a centerpiece! Very pleased and will order this product again!
customer_reviews.author: Gillian Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally put a piece of my gold jewelry through the dryer. It was pretty beat up and scratched I thought for sure it would need a professional polish. But after 2 rounds of this stuff with microfiber cloth and a tooth brush it's looking amazing. Didnt take out the deeper scratches but definitely cleaned up all the smaller stuff beautifully and brought back the shine.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: Shocked by results
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I didn't take any before and after pictures. I assumed this wasn't going to work I was shocked how it somehow removes the fine scratches from stainless steel. I used it on a scratched up watch screw down caseback. Deep scratches remain of course but the type of scratches that would some from a scrubbing sponge go away with this.
customer_reviews.author: techyoda

customer_reviews.title: Horrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: Received item with polishing cream spilled inside of its packaging bag. There was not a separate safety seal on container opening to prevent leakage, in which I assume this is probably why the container was packaged inside it's own small poly bag. After cleaning outside of container, I was only left with half of the product; less than 2oz of the 4.5oz tub. Sadly, the cream did not work well on all my metals; only on some. I've used better metal polishing products. May never buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: ThisHappyLady

customer_reviews.title: My jewelry has never looked so good!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to clean sterling silver and white gold jewelry. Originally I planned to use the jewelry cloths but I wanted something that would get into the nooks and crannies. This, with a small toothbrush and a soft cloth does an amazing job. The shine you get after a nice buffing is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen H.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used this to polish out some deeply etched in water stains in aluminum wheels. It worked very well, I just found one product that "maybe" worked slightly better, but it was very close. Overall, I was very happy and will try it on other items.
customer_reviews.author: Coach 62

customer_reviews.title: Magic!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this polish on gold, platinum and silver. It does a great job. It works best on silver. I polished up a heavily worn, vintage sterling ring and it looked new. It took off all the tarnish and smoothed out the scratches in the metal. Anything you use it on will need a thorough soap and water was to get the residue off. Also be careful using it near easily scratched stones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my Jewelry!
customer_reviews.text: My Bronze Brooch ended up with gunk that's pretty much impossible to get out unless I get a needle. Another brooch that came from my Aunt changes and ended up looking closer to silver when it was gold. I have no idea what this stuff was supposed to do but I regret buying it. Lemon juice worked better for cleaning. Two brooches now tossed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lambert

customer_reviews.title: It works with some elbo grease
customer_reviews.text: Too bad its such a soft cream, if it was harder it would have been much better. It takes time but brass I used it on that was completely gone is back to life, but it takes some work. Bought something from a show that worked much better but they are no longer in business.
customer_reviews.author: mack

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised.
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised, cleans silver and metals quickly. I used a tiny amount to clean and polish several rings I found in a box of items I'd packed away years ago and they look like new.
customer_reviews.author: gmkp

customer_reviews.title: Maybe!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my brass at work. Works great for one day then you have to clean it all over again for the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works okay to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This works okay. I bought it to clean jewelry. It does clean but didn’t restore shine.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: What was good is now questionable
customer_reviews.text: This product works great I used it multiple times polishing my watch band. I had it on a shelf for 3 months in an air conditioned home and it started separating in turning liquid. I stirred it up now it is a liquid not a cream. It still works but I'm kind of baffled Why did this happened?
customer_reviews.author: Snogold

customer_reviews.title: Works Really Well
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many different metal polishes for my sterling silver, brass, and copper jewelry, and Midas Touch is the only product that works really well. It's easy to use, not messy, not caustic (on your hands or neck when wearing just-polished necklaces), and shines everything beautifully, even very heavily tarnished pieces. I've found my go-to product for jewelry cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Quizeen

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: I love this product as a first time customer I was worried to use it. But honestly it has my brass infinity bracelet looking brand new and my hello gold class ring looks just as good as the day I first got it. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: moma_sheba

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best silver cleaner I have ever used. I have an antique silver overlay bowl of my grandmother's that desperately needed cleaning. The silver polish I had was not working, so I ordered this one. It worked so well with much less force which is great because the piece is delicate. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. Crane

customer_reviews.title: Also works for watch glass scratches
customer_reviews.text: makes everything bright and shiny! bought for a watch with scratches and scruffs on the glass. First sanded the scratches away but was a matte finish. Then i tried this product and made it crystal clear like new!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on old brass!
customer_reviews.text: This cream did absolutely nothing for the brass hardware on my antique chest and dresser. If anything it made it worse. It resulted in a smeared finish of varying hues. Would never recommend!
customer_reviews.author: still hopeful

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional polish for 18k gold
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. My 18k yellow gold wedding band got extremely scratched up a few months ago when I fell down on the pavement. I thought I would need to get it professionally buffed by a jeweler but nope! This product did the trick within only a few minutes and my wedding band looks almost brand new again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B. Durazzo

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Platinum
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I use it on all my Platinum rings and they look fabulous!
customer_reviews.author: angela armke

customer_reviews.title: Cleans my jewelry very well.  Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to clean my gold jewelry with and it works great. In fact, much better than I could have expected. I have tried other metal cleaners but I think this has ingredients in it especially for jewelry.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S

customer_reviews.title: Good Product But...
customer_reviews.text: this is meant to be used when polishing your fine jewelry with a polishing wheel. It is rouge based - a fantastic tarnish remover but you'll spend a great deal of time trying to hand polish.
customer_reviews.author: Craig in NYC

customer_reviews.title: The real deal, not just a tarnish remover.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find a real polishing paste with jewelers rouge in it locally, so I turned to Amazon and found this. Most polishes I've seen are just designed for shining up already polished metal, but this will smooth and polish raw metal. This paste and a polishing wheel on my Dremel made for quick and easy work on a new trigger I bought for my Remington 1911. It slicked up the bow beautifully, and I also used it to add some shine to the trigger shoe itself. Worked so well I started thinking of what other items I have around the house to polish! Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Next thing you know am polishing everything.
customer_reviews.text: Before and after pics. As you can see, it works great! I published it by hand and using on lo y a rag cloth. I can imagine how much better it would have looked if I had used an electric polisher and finished it with a microfiber cloth. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ five stars 🚫it turn a bracelet that my wife had pink. It was "silver" at first but after using the cream and polishing it it turn to a copper color. The bracelet was a knockoff of Tiffany's.
customer_reviews.author: BlackInkPhoto

customer_reviews.title: Tarnish comes back worse than before...
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a sterling silver ring after chlorine made it look awful. When it's first used, the ring looks good as new. But i've noticed my ring tarnishing really quickly now. I cleaned it with this stuff less than a week ago, and it's already tarnished again. I also used this on gold plated earrings and it took off the plating. Probably my fault with that one, but still
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth royce

customer_reviews.title: The  jewelers rouge in the polish formula adds that extra glitter, making your sterling silver sparkle!  Go for it !!
customer_reviews.text: The jewelers rouge mixed into the polish makes this polish particularly useful as a final polish after using other brands to take off the heavy tarnish. I am not implying "Midas Touch" won't remove the gunk on heavily tarnished silver, I'm using it for the final polish because I own other polishes already & am trying to stretch out the supply of the polish
customer_reviews.author: Quincy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing and is a must buy. I used it to polish an antique gold piano lamp that was very tarnished. I used an old cloth and rubbed the product in circular motions. Though, I must say the process of polishing was very long and tiring. However, the results were well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Emma F.

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I got this product to polish my bronze candle sticks. It did the job nicely. However, you have to use it sparingly because if you use liberally, it becomes very difficult to attain the desired shine.
customer_reviews.author: rs

customer_reviews.title: Magic in the jar
customer_reviews.text: What kind of sorcery is this ? I mean .. I was not just surprised.. I was shocked from results. I use it to clean up some vintage silver jewelry and omg ... I mean it’s almost like diamond polish .
customer_reviews.author: Irina NY

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic results but be prepared to do a lot of polishing by hand. Results are well worth results. Used on several 925 Sterling Silver pieces of Jewelry. After numerous polishing, results are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: MICHELLE W

customer_reviews.title: Midas has the touch!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! I collect and use my knives a lot and have nkt given them a proper cleaning. So i decided to try out this product that i saw while searching for a polishing cream. And it worked wonder it gave back life to my old Buck 110 that i have had for 4 years now. And i will be trying this on other metals that i have in my home and will put updates on how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I am blown away by how well this polishes. Doesn’t take much to get your jewelry sparkling again. Very pleased. Definitely will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Nicol

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Works well with polishing my watch. Use a rotary to get best results. Used my Seiko as a tester. Turned out very good. Now will move on to my expensive watches.
customer_reviews.author: co2smoke

customer_reviews.title: Petroleum distillate as main ingredient
customer_reviews.text: Has petroleum distillates in it For people who want more naturally occurring cleaners
customer_reviews.author: Safeshopper0

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Great value for the price. Wish I would have taken before/after pics of my jewelry. I was just so anxious to see if it would make my jewelry wearable again & it did! Unfortunately, it doesn't take out dings (it's not supposed too) my favorite pieces are just very well loved. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Works well on different metals.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second jar. I have almost used it all up. It does a great job. You need to use some elbow grease to go with it, but brass and silver sparkle and shine after using this polishing cream. I will buy another jar when this one is empty.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Thompson

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works extremely well !`
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for it's intended purpose of polishing metal but alwo to polish fountain pens. It works wonders on old plastic pens, caps (sometimes metal) and the barrells. Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: James H. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I cleaned this jewelry in a ultrasonic jewelry cleaner machine first and it still came out with discolored/tarnish. Used midas touch and it rubbed off like magic. So easy to use. It has restored my old jewelry to like new!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Savage

customer_reviews.title: Greasy
customer_reviews.text: It's harder to get the cleaner off than the tarnish because the product is very greasy. It also doesn't work well.
customer_reviews.author: JoA59

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Brass!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve mostly been using this to polish tarnished brass thrift shop finds, and it works beautifully! I use a little on a microfiber cloth and in just a few minutes have a refreshed, shiny piece of brass. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shine !
customer_reviews.text: This product put the nicest shine on my Gold Jewelry I have ever seen. I used it on everything I have. It beats polishing cloths, Liquid dips with the little basket, The Shine is Unreal , also it takes out small scratches
customer_reviews.author: PAUL J

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Very sticky and hard to polish at metal.. too dry.. might have use it in a wrong way or something. Still silver didn’t come out good after using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More expensive than Wrights. Very greasy. Difficult to remove even with hot soapy water.
customer_reviews.text: It's more expensive than Wrights paste,Very greasy and difficult to remove even with hot soapy water.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Silver

customer_reviews.title: Not a great cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: Product tends to get all over and does NOT clean all metals. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: Terry D. Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Took about 2-3 minutes with a generic microfiber cloth and that old ring was gleaming like it hasn't in well over a decade
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to polish up an old tarnished silver ring. Took about 2-3 minutes with a generic microfiber cloth and that old ring was gleaming like it hasn't in well over a decade. Best part? I probably used less than 0.001% of the tube. I would HIGHLY recommend this for removing silver tarnish from a smooth surface.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmic55

customer_reviews.title: read carefully
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this product I was really shopping for a product that could re-plate my silver. I read wrong but I don't have any regrets. it was superb on my silver jewelry.
customer_reviews.author: Novelette

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned up some copper sheeting good after polishing
customer_reviews.text: This stuff seems to work as described. Cleaned up some copper sheeting good after polishing. A little acetone afterward brought it to a mirror shine. Even works decent on stainless when I buffed out an old sink.
customer_reviews.author: Digger

customer_reviews.title: Works 100%
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT IS ABSOLUTELY WORTH IT !!! It was so easy to use, the results were amazing and instant. If your sensitive to smell I advice to wear a mask while using this product. I used both the pre-polish and the polish cream. But just using the pre-polish you see the instant change !
customer_reviews.author: Camila Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Yesssss
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and really does the job shining my wife 's wedding ring ang other jewelry, every year i made sure I have midas metal polished to clean and shine her rings to remind her that I'm still and will always be the same person she said yess too
customer_reviews.author: Deb williams

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: It seems to remove the original color of the piece of jewelry.
customer_reviews.author: Yasmine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: Thos worked well for me on Rose Gold and Sterling Silver. Patience and repetition was the key for me. Sterling Silver scratches so easily. This removed the dull look from Sterling Silver for me. I am quite satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tri

customer_reviews.title: Clean shinny jewelry.
customer_reviews.text: I like how it cleans jewelry it make it shine very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and safe for my treasured copper piece!
customer_reviews.text: At last! Something to shine up my 5-sided copper pyramid. Hadn't polished it since I made it in 2007 because I didn't want to use anything that required a water rinse. Took 13 years of tarnish off with just a bit of rubbing. Fabulous
customer_reviews.author: Zedrouh Reich

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Did not expect this. Wish I had a pic of the jewelry before. Stopped wearing so much if my silver because it was so dingy. This stuff polished it right up. Check out the black on the towels. Love it
customer_reviews.author: S. T.

customer_reviews.title: EXCELENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different kinds of metal polish, hands down this is the best I have ever used. Produces a beautiful finish without a lot of effort. Jim Sommers - Encino, Calif.
customer_reviews.author: James F. Sommers

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL PRODUCT THAT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Buy the larger size! This stuff really works and will easily clean your jewelry, metal items, and other items. Great value!

customer_reviews.title: Good for jewelry
customer_reviews.text: I tried it on silver plated jewelry and it worked like a charm

customer_reviews.text: Used for polishing silver. Did not work for me. Went back to Hagerty's.

customer_reviews.text: Outstanding polish. Using in combination with Maas polish. Both products are excellent.

customer_reviews.text: Works great. Don’t have to be afraid you will make your vintage treasures come out like chrome. You control the age patina you want to keep.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent polish

customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product Really is like magic Gets the job done

customer_reviews.title: Brings your silver back to new
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased about 6 cleaners for older silver jewelry. This has been the only product that’s brought it back to new!!!

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and very efficient. Keeps my gold & silver shiny

customer_reviews.title: The best metal polish ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great polish!! I just "thought" my jewelry and other metals were clean. Nope. Not until I tried this product! Highly recommend it. Shipped quickly and packed well. No leaks!

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to lusterize my antique gold flatware and WOW! It is amazing! Took years of tarnish off of the flatware and went from brassy to actual gold! Definitely a must buy, use sparingly.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Rolf

customer_reviews.title: Works great but need a little elbow grease
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this cleaner but it is not an instant fix. You have to use a little elbow grease as if you were cleaning silverware. I do like that it’s not too abrasive on the jewelry. I will continue to use this.

customer_reviews.title: It's excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product to polish all kinds of metal around the house. Even to polish watches. It's excellent!

customer_reviews.title: a little more difficult to clean the jewelry

customer_reviews.text: This product does just what it is supposed to. It polished up my ring beautifully.

customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend for pewter and that is what I got it for. Overpriced for what it does.

customer_reviews.text: This is extremely impressive. I’ve paid hundreds of dollars to have my watch “professionally” polished. Great product!

customer_reviews.title: How it works
customer_reviews.text: To mix with clear nail polish and apply dots to back of cell phone for to break up waves that cause cancer

customer_reviews.title: Not Great on Coins
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who is loves collecting coins. Did next to nothing to remove tarnish/stains. In fact, a pencil eraser worked better. Very disappointing considering the cost. Anyone have any advice on polishing coins?
customer_reviews.author: Steve Star

customer_reviews.title: Maybe don't use on gold
customer_reviews.text: Used it on my watch and looks good 👍, but when I used it on my gold chain it leave black streak on my cloth and skin 😡. No matter how many times I wipe down on the cloth it still leaves black streaks.
customer_reviews.author: Ezekiel Esquivel

customer_reviews.title: wasn't worth it
customer_reviews.text: I waited to long before i used it to let you know it does't work guess i lost that money.
customer_reviews.author: Babygirl

product_meta.title: Midas Touch Metal Polishing Cream – 1lb, Cleaner & Polishing Rouge for Sterling Silver, Gold, Brass & Other Metals, 1 Pack, by Rolite
product_meta.description:
Size:1lb| Style:1 PackClean, Polish & Protect
Midas Touch Metal Polishing Cream is made with polishing rouge, a compound developed by the jewelry trade to help buffer precious metals and bring out their maximum luster. This innovative formula helps to restore all metals by gently removing tarnish, film and hairline scratches.

Our non-toxic formula is made without harsh chemicals and is safe for a wide variety of applications, including:

 * Antiques
 * Flatware
 * Trophies
 * Jewelry
 * Sterling Silver
 * Serving Pieces
 * Brass Door Fittings
 * Glass Shower Doors
 * Bicycles
 * Chrome Faucets and More

About Rolite
Rolite is one of the leading designers, manufacturers and marketers of professional polishing products across the automotive, marine, aviation, motorcycle, RV, commercial, household, jewelry and antique industries. Established in 1976, the Rolite Company laboratory is a state-of-the-art research facility dedicated to bringing superior quality products that create a brilliant shine.

We design, manufacture and package all of our products in-house from formulas that we have developed. Because we remain a family-owned business, we have the unique ability to stay in close touch with our customers’ requests, and give you the best customer service that you deserve!
feature_bullets: PROTECTS & POLISHES: Gently removes tarnish, film and hairline scratches from most metal surfaces; Innovative formula restores neglected surfaces to their original shine
SAFE ON MOST METALS: Use on gold, brass, copper, bronze, platinum, pewter and sterling silver
VARIETY OF USES: Works great on antiques, flatware, trophies, jewelry, serving pieces, brass door fittings, aluminum screen doors and chrome faucets
FREE FROM HARSH CHEMICALS: Acid-free, silicon-free, odor-free, non-toxic and eco-friendly
HOW TO USE: Apply sparingly with a microfiber cloth to clean, dry, dust-free surface; Rub gently in a circular motion until black residue appears; Buff off with clean, dry cloth
